com.davidsoergel.dsutils.range

Interface Interval<T extends Number & Comparable>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<Interval<T>>, Range<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicInterval, BasicLongRationalInterval, DoubleIntervalRange, MutableBasicInterval

    public interface Interval<T extends Number & Comparable>
extends Comparable<Interval<T>>, Range<T>
    An interval on a number line of type T. Might better be called ContinuousRange?
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    David Soergel

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean encompassesValue(T value)
      Tells whether the given value is contained within the interval or not.
      T getMax()
      Returns the maximum value (the right endpoint) of the interval.
      T getMin()
      Returns the minimum value (the left endpoint) of the interval.
      boolean isClosedLeft()
      Tells whether the minimum value is to be considered inclusive or exclusive.
      boolean isClosedRight()
      Tells whether the maximum value is to be considered inclusive or exclusive.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • encompassesValue

        boolean encompassesValue(T value)
        Tells whether the given value is contained within the interval or not.
        Specified by:
        encompassesValue in interface Range<T extends Number & Comparable>
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        true if the value is within the interval (including the endpoints, if they are closed); false otherwise.

      • getMax

        T getMax()
        Returns the maximum value (the right endpoint) of the interval.
        Returns:
        the maximum value (the right endpoint) of the interval.

      • getMin

        T getMin()
        Returns the minimum value (the left endpoint) of the interval.
        Returns:
        the minimum value (the left endpoint) of the interval.

      • isClosedLeft

        boolean isClosedLeft()
        Tells whether the minimum value is to be considered inclusive or exclusive.
        Returns:
        true if the minimum value is inclusive; false otherwise.

      • isClosedRight

        boolean isClosedRight()
        Tells whether the maximum value is to be considered inclusive or exclusive.
        Returns:
        true if the maximum value is inclusive; false otherwise.
